posts.body: Ideas on how to stop the spammer?

>>e4ec0eed-e962-4e77-9943-a7ec20406765
You jinxed it you fuck!
Well, If your ever in the North Pacific, This one guy has got your back.

It may be down to other users. I set my settings to serve all content, but I also set the max file size limit to 20MB.

If you can not find a peer willing to take on such a big file, then it will never reach the wider network.

>Drags ZeroNet icon to the left 
>Sets "Download and help distribute all files" to on
>feels good man

Are you doing your part?

PS: only do this if you can avoid rawdogging your connection. Using a no log VPN that allows port forwarding (E.G: PIA) gives best results.

Pro Tip: You can normally get your ISP to give you a new IP by disconnecting your modem for around 15 minutes or more. Powering down the modem overnight before you go to sleep will most certainly result in a new IP by morning.

VPN's are dead cheep now days. Just tunnel and funnel the network.

Yes, you have to act as a personal moderator over the files you host. But that is the responsibility you take on when helping to host user content.

Frankly, the CP and loli boards are there for the muck, and if you blacklist them, That's 90% of your job done. Users that can't respect that will get muted to oblivion and will find it harder to find seeders that will peddle their fagotry.

>>f0eadf52-67ab-428c-9cf7-7ed0827bb011
The BO really needs to migrate to the new MC version. It seems that a lot of the problems on this board can be fixed by doing so.

>>ff946e83-5117-4592-b32e-3937dcf29c6b
From what I understand, the code monkeys over on /tech/ are hammering at the bits as we speak.
When they have a working build, The BO may just make it live to all users.
Try check files.

Testing something, Let me know what happens when you click the image.

You should see the number change.

wow... that actually worked. well, just found a way to edit images after posting i guess.

ug.. I will fix that image later i guess as-well.

OK, Back from work, Will tell you how it is done now.

>Make a post with an image
>Find your user folder in data\1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D\data\users. Best way to find your folder is by hovering over your image, and you will see your ID in the URL at the bottom of your browser.
>take note of the file type/file names of the Thumbnail and the main image in SRC.
>change the thumbnail and /src/ image to what you want (as long as it is the same file type) and give them the file name that was given to the original files.
>Go back to your post you was modifying the images for and click E and then Edit.

The edit Function will then recommit the change in your user and /src as part of the edit update sent out to peers.

The image in my last post (>>3723fdf0-5ccb-4c64-9734-20f7bf8c2aa5) Was broke because of the tor image bug. I have now managed to manually fix it within the back end on my local copy and publish it back into the network.
The magic image never lies

>>26f11f76-b681-48a4-88e9-8c23faf6c56d
just gave this for /b to play with. Im sure it will keep them amused.

>>336767c3-8394-4b07-96df-fc65f5bfe602

>18+ stattus = Unknow.

>>3533fc50-2010-4a80-87fc-c68b76eec92c
Err... You should not be seeing names. What are you seeing? My zero id?

>>d7ff87e6-5442-43da-9b74-caab9998d026
Plain it is then.

>>8f0a46ee-e6c1-4ee0-bfc3-70b0821638a8
Can i just say some anons already think it's a honeypot. 

Some anons think ZeroNet is a honeypot.

Some anons think 8chan and 4chan are honeypots.

Every thing is a honeypot if your going to take "some" as the baseline.

Also, your site does not have a big warning telling anons to only use 08chan if ZeroNet is in always tor mode, or to use a VPN. Nor does it explain how to enable always tor.

Saying: 
>Verify all of Zeronet's settings are set to TOR mode, except the TOR bridges. 
is a bit vage. They will just see Tor:Avalable and think its all configgered.

Because of this, You may have just started the Journo IP hunnypot, electric boogaloo.

>>dc490cf5-0703-4b0d-8339-06492bf0014b
Well, That does depend on your country. A Hidden volume may be the way to go, But i was always suspect about this. A system log, indexing journal entry or a virus scanner just doing its thing could document its existence.

The only real solution i can think of is a VM with two OS's. One dummy, one hidden.

It is not unusual to have a toy VM that you do not do very much with, and it also allows you to use your normal environment with the hidden VM doing its thing in the background. 

This allows you to seed all day, do your other activity in your actual system, and gives you the ability to hand over a password to your dummy VM OS, if law requires you to hand over a password upon request.

>>1093628b-a3c2-45cb-ad9a-6005fda6d929
Just to warn you. Your OS/software may accidentally leak the existence of hidden containers, via logs, indexing, virus scans etc.

>>6cdfb6d5-7dbc-499a-8620-c4090b0f221c
Also, I vote 3.

Other notes:

> 3. Ability to store the board on a spare partition with plausible deniability to run it from Tails (8/10) [0]
Use a VHD/VM, With a dummy/hidden OS. That way, All OS logs that could give away any hidden volume stay in the hidden OS. People have VM's that are hardly used and are just a toy/testing bed, so hardly having anything on the dummy can not be considered probable cause for a hidden OS.

>5. Research the possibility of setting up a custom CA, which would make it possible to generate certs for every post, basically making everyone anonymous, but it would still be centralized and open to for example DDoS (7/10) [0]
You can have it where for each post, a new public key is generated. that way, the owner of the privet key can still edit there own posts while the public key's appear random for each post. When spam is detected, the CA refuses to accept any new public keys for that cert. This would however brake muting users, and move the site to central moderation.

> 6. Research seed ratio based proof-of-work for posting, which would allow decentralized anonymous posting without additional CPU usage (9/10) [0]
Look into Tribler. it is a fully decentralized torrent client, that uses seed based poof of work to kick out Torrent Leechers.

posts.subject: 08chan Mod Team
posts.body:
Hello and welcome to 08chan. I have started a board called /MT/ - Moderation Team. This is where you can get a pre-made black list of content that you may not want to host.

We only have pedo and bestiality user lists at the moment, but if you link a post and categorize it before muting the user on your end, it will help us build a comprehensive list to help moderate easily.

>>827afefe-dc60-455f-a64b-17421df58d39
I do also echo the concern of this flaunting going on. 

>>2cd6caa0-c781-46e4-9080-3eb3e70a198e
I posted in your welcome /tay/ group as i felt it would be useful and was courteous. You could of just pointed this out there (as you did) and/or, leave a courteous comment here saying, "we are also working on this solution" and called it a day. 

But instead, You felt the need to call this board retarded, claim you  already have "these lists"
>("reason": "L0:Pedo") not found in the file. 
linked your repo and your 08ch.net pet project, and recommended "your" solution over this.

This said, any effort to make moderation easier is welcome, and here is why this is fundamentally different;

A. This blacklist is built with transparency in site, and it Is solely to list users that are at a high risk of posting content that is illegal to distribute, with different legality tears.

B. Your blacklist just states.
>"reason": "Bad User", 
Is is not very helpful.

C. To check the list, you recommend using custom software. This is something a lot of anon's, including me, are not going to do unless it gains a good reputation. 
>tl;dr: use this totallynotavirus.exe

D. Your blacklist is very large, and i suspect there are some personal blocks in their from the anon that submitted it. Again. "Bad User" is not very informative.

E. This method allows the community to moderate, report, and plug in users as they go in a transparent manner.

I will however look forward to having usernamesareover's tool audited by other anons, as it would be very useful.

>>0d13e175-d7f2-4de2-9288-8ae169720e35
I already did mention this... But OK, i have now streamlined the instructions so they are as easy and clear as I can make them.

posts.subject: List Editting Instructions

posts.body:
>>43bb201b-dbc6-4c43-839b-72c0a12422c0
>I said organizing this in threads is retarded.
well, it keeps things on the site, and is checked and categorized. 

I think it is not very productive to have a massive blacklist that has not been organized, nor is it distinguishable from personal entry's, making uninstalling it nigh impossible.

>Also the "Bad user" is made by the M button I believe.
It is, You need to edit it per entry.

>Also nice job on censoring my post.
It was clutter bumping down the lists. Now all the sticky's are sorted, it will be unblacklisted.

>>b2440570-91b0-4f82-b74a-cf9b814963cd
>Concerning D, the blacklist is very large because every single one of the spam posters with the big posts is in there.

This I don't like the idea of. A lot of things are considered spam to different users. What is your policy regarding what is spam?
If we are on about the Lorem-ipsum text spammer, that was on here before ZeroID's, yes. 
If we are talking about generals that are repeatedly posted, then no. That is down to the user to moderate individually.

This is why i felt it would be best to keep this strictly to illegal posts, As this is what all users will  want to blacklist.

>>08dec815-b9ce-4413-89a9-821771ca28d6
I'm not against using your code from the repo. And will see if /tech would like to give it an audit.

I do however see the concerns of wnfkalkdfhyweiuo and acid. This project has the potential to have a lot of users use the zite. But, because of its bundled nature, and it's apparent officialty, it gives a lot of power to the repo owner over what is distributed. with the point being that this is decentralized, That is, as I'm sure you can understand, an elephant in the room.

>>7e61ede1-b462-4b9b-99ad-9ba9d11c02f0
>I meant the text spammer. I've also muted a few porn posters because they shit up my folders and made searching for CP difficult.

See, this is my concern. Dew to your methodology, the black list is poisoned with bad entrys, that can not be easily removed. It all just blends in with all the other entrys with no ability to pick out the junk.

posts.subject: Anon audit needed
posts.body:
So, This user "usernamesareover" has made a tool to check all the posts a user has ever posted. This would be useful for checking blacklists for validity.

The source is available at. 
https://gitgud.io/08chan/post-checker.

The user is obviously not used to open sourcing code projects, but it would be good to know if the code is legit, and also build on it if possible.

If any anon would like to take on board an audit, this would be a very useful tool for 08chan users.

>>c1813b41-4bc8-46da-8050-2cb37605a343 
@taylovedyou.
You need to give "usernamesareover" access to the repo and let him manage his post checker tool.

>>67d61329-be52-453b-861d-672c6dd14982
@usernamesareover
You need to add a readme.txt with compiler instructions and settings as well as the binery.exe SHA-2/SHA-256 hash.

would also be useful to add the .exe to the repo.
The idea is, If someone compiled your code from source, with all the same settings, the resulting binary will have the exact same hash. That allows other users to verify that the binary.exe in the repo was indeed built from source, and is not another build with some... well, lets just say special sauce.

If you set up your zeromail you can both talk and arrange the admin on gitgud better.

PS: Bonus internet cookie to whoever identifys this computer. (Pic related)

posts.subject: WELCOME
posts.body:
Welcome, This is a place to report users that have posted illegal content. We will be making a list of user ID's that fall into different categorys so you can self moderate more easily.

L0 : Pedo; People get put onto this list by doing any of the following.
> Post CP.
> Actively seek CP.
> Posts content that is solely just a photograph or video of a child, with no obviously extremely  humorous substance. 
                (You know dam well this is not the place to post your kids photos.)

L1: Bestiality; People get put onto this list by doing the following.
> Post any content that involves sexual activity with a real animal.

L2: Loli: People get put onto this list by doing the following.
> Post drawings that depict children in a pornograthic nature 
                ("It's just art" ain't going to fly sicko).

L3:Gore; People get put onto this list by doing the following.
> Post any content that involves the photography of the real brutal death or injury of any subject.

### How to report content? ###

Format your post like so:
>Post : (post link)
>Category : (E.G Category: L0)

The post will then be inspected and a status will be given.
>Entry added
>Entry rejected : reason
>Entry exists (already on list)
>Entry up for vote ( For when something is ambiguous and it would be better to ask anons for a decision ).

posts.subject: Decluttering Policy
posts.body:
>TL;DR: Please make a new thread to start discussion and make reports. don't reply to the stickys. 
Please note, To reduce clutter, Any replys to the stickyed posts are black listed. This is not to silence people, and i would like to point out that you can disable the black list at the bottom of the page to see what was said. 
However, editing is utilized to reorder the board. Therefore, any comment is likely not to be a reply to that posts content.

>It's a tough subject where we need crystal clear guidelines on what goes on the blacklist and what not.
That is one of the first things I did when making this board. To be frank, it may be worth adopting the guidelines above as a foundation for your blacklist policy, then build on it.

The post check tool could be fleshed out to pars the filters.JOSN file for mute user checking, tagging of offending posts with the ability to add a comment, and noting down reasons in the filters file. Then it can generate a modtags.JOSN with the user, post link, and the reason for the mute, and the filters.JOSN with the reason field edited with a one word reason.

Well, If you hate your self that much, you could always... You know... Pic related.

This has just come to my attention. The zite is now cloned and I will work on editing it for use by 08chan /MT/. 

Also, I would like to ashore you that people only end up on this list for violating the policies above.

What I would like to do is have it so you can subscribe to each list so there is a toggle for each level. That will allow you to choose what depth of blocking you desire. If (and only if) this can be done I may also add the following levels as well.

May add category; Likely illegal. but I don't have any clear universal guidelines to mind. Will think about it more before doing this. One thing I can think of is things like file sharing links that you could get done for if you personally distribute them.

Also Spammers may be added later , But only if it is beyond a reasonable doubt that they are a bot, Or a user that just keeps spamming the board with nonsense, on more than 3 separate occasions.

Note: nonsense is defined as;
>Repetitive flood posting.
Or 
>Repetitive advertising of any site/zite/board across multiple posts/boards.
That reasonably can be seen as unconstructive and universally annoying.
posts.subject: Many Thanks
/MT/ Black List zite is now live!
posts.body:
Getting the Blacklists installed has now been made easy thanks to the [/MT/ BlockList Zite](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GPRp2U1kD8A5hZw7Kbctu9x8Bms7zA3tS/)
Pick what Lists you would like to subscribe to, and when new users are published, ZeroNet will sync the Blocklist update automagically. 

Many thanks to g4us69jk for the tip.
bump

posts.subject: /MT/ (Moderation Team) Announcement.
posts.body:
I would like to invite you all to try out the new [/MT/ 08chan BlockList Zite.](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GPRp2U1kD8A5hZw7Kbctu9x8Bms7zA3tS/)
If you would like to know more about /MT/'s blacklist policy and how users are added to the list, pay a visit to the [/MT/ board](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/1LkM33Rh7DP79wJFKKCYiFKv6tkgyXtnGC:MT:0) and have a gander.

Also, would like to ask that if you see a post that falls into any category that is under monitoring, Please report on the /MT/ board before blacklisting, as entries need to be verifyed before adding them to the lists.

posts.subject: /MT/ (Moderation Team) Announcement.
posts.body:
I would like to invite you all to try out the new [/MT/ 08chan BlockList Zite.](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GPRp2U1kD8A5hZw7Kbctu9x8Bms7zA3tS/)
If you would like to know more about /MT/'s blacklist policy and how users are added to the list, pay a visit to the [/MT/ board](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/1LkM33Rh7DP79wJFKKCYiFKv6tkgyXtnGC:MT:0) and have a gander.

Also, would like to ask that if you see a post that falls into any category that is under monitoring, Please report on the /MT/ board before blacklisting, as entries need to be verifyed before adding them to the lists.

It's more of a question of bit torrent distribution and the possession of such images. We unfortunately do not of safe Harbor protection (at the very least, This has not been tested in court) or, we are not all seeding from countries that don't give a fuck unless you're jacking it to kids.

But that is why I modified the site to have segregated lists. You are welcome to just sub to the CP list and call it a day.

The main point is that just having one big list with users blocked for who knows what is impractical. With this, You know why they are blocked, and you can sub to however your sensibility / local laws align.

>>13d7a8da-716f-4ed1-87a1-f5b5eca1b7b9
>so , what is the difference from clearnet ... 
>this is basically the same censorship we see on clearnet.
>let people decide who should be muted and who shouldn't

Err... It's optional... Im not makeing you sub to the block list. If you like it. Sub. if you don't, well, don't.

>>1d8eae02-192c-472b-b473-885212560b22

No, Just volunteers reporting stuff that is illegal to distribute from your connection.
I seed this site 24/7. For more to do so, makeing Moderation more convenient will help.

>A system like this becomes inevitably authoritarian in time, because power corrupts.

I find that unlikely. I am a staunch supporter of all the degenerate fun on chan sites. I Just draw the line at getting picked up by the party van because someone has a boner for things most countries will not only IRL ban you for, but also actively try to track you down if you was involved in any way.

But ok, i will make the site more clear and retard proof. May be in a few hours or tomorrow.

>>405a73e6-8eb0-4163-a4e3-ce21367e605a
I played arround with an experimental project with /MT/ and Made a zite that allows for the easy blocking of users that posted illegal content.

I havent seen any CP or Loli for about a month now. Well, not any out of place postings in the populer bords anyway.

As it stands however, 08chan is slow enough for it to be a one man pet project. but a better solution would be required with heavier traffic. 

It might be worth having a more official blacklist based off of it, if there are plans to front the zite to the clear net. Could have it on by defalt for the proxy, and make it a volenteary opt in for the zite. 

some kind of official reporting and voting system could also be useful.
